Submodules¶

scraper.Data_Cleaner module¶

class scraper.Data_Cleaner.DataCleaner(filename)¶

Bases: object

clean(output_name)¶

This function takes in a dataframe and outputs a cleaned dataframe

Parameters:

output_name – the name of the output file

static clean_bac_(a)¶

This function clean the degree information It takes a string as input, and returns a string as output. It maps the degree information whatever its shape is, and returns a simple degree that will be easier to understand

Parameters:

a – the string to be cleaned

Returns:

A string

static clean_debut_(a)¶

This function clean the beginning date information

  • If the string contains the word “possible”, return “Dès que possible”

  • If the string contains the word “semestre” or “trimestre”, return the string in lowercase

  • If the string contains the word “à” or “au”, return NaN

  • If the string contains the word “de” or “pour” or “debut” followed by a space and a 4-digit number, return the

4-digit number - If the string contains a date in the format “dd/mm/yyyy”, return the month and year in lowercase - If the string contains a word followed by a space and a 4-digit number, return the word and the 4-digit number in lowercase - Otherwise, return NaN

Parameters:

a – the string to be cleaned

Returns:

A string

clean_duree_(a)¶

This function clean the duration information

It takes a string as input, and returns a list of integers if the string contains a range of months, or a single integer if the string contains a single month

Parameters:

a – the string to be cleaned

Returns:

A list of integers

data_cleaning()¶

It cleans the dataframe by replacing the ‘Non spécifié’ values with NaN, dropping duplicates, and cleaning the Bac, Début, Type de contrat, and Durée columns

to_csv(filename: str)¶

This function takes a dataframe and a filename as input and saves the dataframe as a csv file with the given filename.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the file to be written to.

Returns:

The dataframe is being returned.
